column4: Hi, question, how is HD Playback in ubuntu 11.04 using Intel's driver integrated?
depends on cpu i suppose
most comps play hd fine nowadays
i;m asking because i have Dual win7 and Ubuntu 11.04, and win7 plays hd files perfectly, but in ubuntu i get choppy/laggy video
what movie player are you using on ubuntu?
i mean it will be cpu bound
what player yu use?
mplayer2
i heard something about vdpau, is that a driver?
it uses the nvidia card so it uses no cpu
oooh i see :(
try mplayer2 its very fast prob the fastest player
going to install it right now and try it
it has no gui so youll have to type mplayer2 /video
i just set my file manager to open video files with mplayer2
alright let me try
try mplayer1 then, but afaik its not developed any more
alright
its accel for youur card
mplayer plays them all
